title: WESTWORLD Season 3 Episode 2 Breakdown, Theories, and Details You Missed!
author: Think Story
comment: Out of all the worlds in the WW universe, which one would you most like to go to? (West, War, Shogun, Raj, Medieval, Roman)
So, Drogon flew all the way back from the Kingslanding to Medieval World(Westworld) just in search of good writers.
Hbo should make it so that the the last season on GOT was just a Wesworld simulation.

I believe they've taken a page from the classic sci-fi story "Rossum's Universal Robots" (R.U.R), the very first sci-fi story (from the 1920's no less) to use the word "robot".  In it, the robots rebel and slaughter all Mankind, but by doing so unwittingly destroy the secret knowledge of sentience creation (they can make their own bodies, but not their minds) and thus doom themselves to ultimately die out as well.  The story ends many years in the future, the dwindling robots are keeping the last human alive (a simple tech from the factory where they were first built), forcing him to try again and again to re-discover the secret of their own creation...

Theory: the entire scene with Serac isn't real either because the Serac that we meet is a personification of Rehoboam. So maybe Rehoboam is what killed Dempsey senior. This would parallel Ford's story, in which his creation eventual kills him.
description:
In this video we breakdown, explain, review, and recap Season 3 Episode 2 "The Winter Line" of HBO's Westworld for new theories, easter eggs, and details you missed. The new season stars Aaron Paul, Evan Rachel Wood, Ed Harris and Jeffrey Wright.
